name: JavaScript ES6
description: Modern JavaScript features introduced in ES6

cards.front: What is the arrow function syntax in ES6?
cards.back: const functionName = (param) => { return value; } or const functionName = param => value for single expression
A syntax for extracting values from arrays or objects into distinct variables. Example: const {name, age} = person
String literals using backticks that allow embedded expressions: `Hello ${name}`
The ... operator that expands an iterable into individual elements. Example: [...array1, ...array2]
Block-scoped variable declarations introduced in ES6. let is mutable, const is immutable
Function parameters that have default values if not provided: function greet(name = 'Guest') {}
Objects representing the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation

cards.front: What is the difference between map() and forEach()?
cards.back: map() returns a new array with transformed elements, while forEach() performs an action but returns undefined
